title: Relief of Venus, Mars, and Cupid at Vulcan's Forge
credit_line: Purchase: gift of the Women's Committee
provenance_text:
Commissioned by Gerrit Hooft Gerritz [-1780], Amsterdam, Netherlands. (Sold at Frederik Muller & Co, Amsterdam, Netherlands, on June 20, 1928) [1]; purchased by Jacques Goudstikker [1897-1940], Amsterdam, Netherlands [2]. (Sold at Frederik Muller & Co, Amsterdam, Netherlands, on March 24, 1950) [3]. (Possibly French and Company, New York, NY) [4]. (Sold at Parke-Bernet Galleries, New York, NY, November 14, 1968); purchased by Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA. 
NOTES: [1] Lot 4. [2] Jacques Goudstikker was an art dealer in Amsterdam. When he purchased this work, it moved to his property at 458 Herengracht, Amsterdam. Fleeing the Nazis, Goudstikker and his family left Amsterdam in 1940, leaving behind his private collection and showrooms. While crossing to America, Goudstikker died in an accident aboard the ship. [3] Lot 839. [4] The certainty of French & Company's ownership has not been able to be verified as of November 2015. See correspondence from French & Co. from March 17, 1980 in curatorial file.
